thread.title: Watson throws for 3 TDs in No. 5 Clemson's 34-17 victory
thread.title_full: Watson throws for 3 TDs in No. 5 Clemson's 34-17 victory

author: PETE IACOBELLI
title: Watson throws for 3 TDs in No. 5 Clemson's 34-17 victory
text:
Rainier Ehrhardt Watson throws for 3 TDs in No. 5 Clemson's 34-17 victory 
Clemson wide receiver Artavis Scott (3) runs into the end zone for a touchdown as Boston College defensive back Kamrin Moore (5) defends during the second half of an NCAA college football game, Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Clemson, S.C. (AP Photo/Rainier Ehrhardt) Rainier Ehrhardt Watson throws for 3 TDs in No. 5 Clemson's 34-17 victory 
Clemson tight end Jordan Leggett (16) catches a pass for a touchdown as Boston College linebacker Matt Milano (28) defends during the second half of an NCAA college football game, Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Clemson, S.C. (AP Photo/Rainier Ehrhardt) Rainier Ehrhardt Watson throws for 3 TDs in No. 5 Clemson's 34-17 victory 
Clemson head coach Dabo Swinney walks on the sideline during the first half of an NCAA college football game against Boston College, Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Clemson, S.C. (AP Photo/Rainier Ehrhardt) Rainier Ehrhardt Watson throws for 3 TDs in No. 5 Clemson's 34-17 victory 
Clemson quarterback Deshaun Watson (4) waves to fans after scoring a touchdown against Boston College during the first half of an NCAA college football game, Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Clemson, S.C. (AP Photo/Rainier Ehrhardt) Rainier Ehrhardt Watson throws for 3 TDs in No. 5 Clemson's 34-17 victory 
Boston College quarterback Jeff Smith (5) throws a pass as Clemson linebacker Ben Boulware (10) defends during the first half of an NCAA college football game, Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Clemson, S.C. (AP Photo/Rainier Ehrhardt) Posted: Saturday, October 17, 2015 10:45 pm Watson throws for 3 TDs in No. 5 Clemson's 34-17 victory Associated Press | 0 comments 
CLEMSON, S.C. (AP) — Deshaun Watson passed for three touchdowns and a season-best 420 yards and No. 5 Clemson rolled against Boston College's top-ranked defense for a 34-17 victory Saturday night. 
Watson added a rushing touchdown and the Tigers improved to 6-0 (3-0 Atlantic Coast Conference) for the third time in five seasons. Watson finished 27-of-41, including touchdowns throws of 21 yards to Zac Brooks, 51 yards to Artavis Scott and 6 yards to Jordan Leggett. kAm$4@EE 925 `_ 42E496D 7@C `ea J2C5D 2D r=6>D@?
